My wild adventure in Peru

Hey everyone, welcome back to my blog! This time, I want to share my amazing trip to Peru – what an adventure!

First, I flew to Cusco, a city high in the mountains. At 3,500 metres, the altitude made me feel dizzy at first. After a day of rest, I was ready to explore – I was happy to the busy city life. I decided to a small tent and sleeping bag because my goal was to nature. I joined a group of travellers, and together, we started hiking towards Machu Picchu. The hike was tough. We had to steep* trails, cold rivers, and walk for hours under the midday heat. But the views were incredible! We saw waterfalls, llamas, and deep valleys. It was late afternoon when we managed to to a field. We decided to set up our camp there. It was peaceful, but it’s not easy to on the hard ground!

On my way to Machu Picchu, I a friend of mine who started her hike two days before me. She was travelling with some interesting people from different countries. One of them, a guy from Canada, was there to a photography project about Peruvian culture. He taught me how to take better pictures. After four days, we finally reached Machu Picchu. Standing there, looking at the ancient ruins, I felt proud. The journey was hard, but totally worth it. I even saw a condor flying high above the mountains! For the last part of my trip, I took a car to the Sacred Valley. I explored small villages, and I wanted to local people who made beautiful hats and scarves by hand.

Now, I’m back home, but I am ready to another adventure. Have you ever travelled somewhere wild? Let me know in the comments!


VOCABULARY: *steep – steil
